most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Database Corruption on Startup
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to start due to database corruption on various operating systems. The issue stems from a missing subfolder crucial for database initialization and a dependency requiring AVX2 support, affecting older CPUs. Proposed solutions include manually creating the missing folder and a fix addressing both issues in a future release.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start.

## Summary of the GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Antoine79 reported an issue with the database on initial bootup.
* Mark-at-pieces identified potential solutions and offered help.
* Antoine79 confirmed encountering the problem even after deleting the database folder.
* Mark-at-pieces mentioned a fix with additional logging in v11.3.1.
* NidroySoft reported the issue persisting in version 11.3.1.
* Antoine79 identified two issues:
    * Missing subfolder `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2`
    * Lack of AVX2 support causing CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch dependency issue

**Problems identified:**

* Database corruption due to missing subfolder.
* CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch dependency requiring AVX2 support, causing the issue on older CPUs.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces proposed a fix with additional logging in v11.3.1.
* Antoine79 manually created the missing folder, revealing the AVX2 dependency issue.
* Mark-at-pieces is working on a fix to address both issues.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is under investigation and a fix is being developed.
* Mark-at-pieces will update the channel when the fix is available.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of detailed logs and user feedback in troubleshooting complex issues.
* It also demonstrates the potential impact of hardware limitations on software compatibility.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* @moazzem-pixel reported an issue where Pieces OS wouldn't start due to database corruption.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant team member.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of an existing issue (#686).

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS wouldn't start due to database corruption.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user was directed to continue the conversation on the existing issue (#686).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation has been moved to the existing issue (#686).

**Additional Information:**

* The user was also provided with links to relevant resources, including existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## GitHub Issue Summary: Authentication Problems After Update

**Key Points:**

- Users reported authentication issues after updating Pieces OS to version 11.3.0.
- They were unable to link their Google accounts and faced an infinite loading screen when trying to log in.

**Problems Identified:**

- Issue was related to the authentication flow and the callback process between Pieces OS and the authentication service.
- Manually refreshing the `https://authentication.pieces.services/` page caused issues in the callback.

**Solutions Implemented:**

- Pieces team investigated the authentication pipelines to locate the problem.
- The issue was identified and fixed within a few hours.

**Current Status:** 

- Authentication service should be working again, as confirmed by users who were experiencing the problem.

**Outcome:**

- The problem has been resolved, and users can now successfully link their Google accounts and log in.

recommendations: **Prioritize database stability:** Investigate and address the root cause of the database corruption issue impacting Pieces OS startup. This appears to be a recurring problem affecting multiple users across different operating systems.

**Improve communication on AVX2 dependency:** Clearly communicate the AVX2 support requirement for Pieces OS, potentially including it in the system requirements or release notes. This will help users with older CPUs understand compatibility issues.
**Monitor authentication flow:** While the recent authentication issue seems resolved, continue monitoring the authentication process for any recurring problems, especially after updates.

**Review and update documentation:** Ensure that the documentation and troubleshooting guides are updated to include information about the database corruption issue and its potential solutions, including the AVX2 dependency.
